head.title: PROPERTY VALUES: What You Get for ... Under $200,000

hedline.hl1: PROPERTY VALUES: What You Get for ... Under $200,000

block.p: Homes on the market in North Wildwood, N.J., Galveston, Tex., and Twenty-Nine Palms, Calif.

This 323-square-foot beachside condo apartment has views of the Atlantic Ocean. North Wildwood, known for its beach, dining and nightlife, is in a resort area on the South Jersey shore called the Wildwoods. It is near the boardwalk and amusement park in Wildwood, 20 minutes from Cape May, about 45 minutes from Atlantic City and an hour and 45 minutes from Philadelphia. The apartment, a recently remodeled corner unit, is on the second floor of a two-story complex built in the 1980s. It has laminate-wood and ceramic-tile floors, maple cabinets and stainless steel kitchen appliances. There are one bath, a washer and dryer and a balcony with an ocean view. It is sold furnished. The condominium complex has an outdoor swimming pool and a patio and grill area. Taxes are $1,945 a year. Teresa DiPeso and Buddy Tarbotton, Oceanside Realty (609) 522-3322; www.teamoceanside.com

This two-story Craftsman-style home is three blocks from the beach and the Gulf of Mexico. Galveston is on an island 32 miles long and two and a half miles wide, about 40 miles south of Houston. It is known for its sandy beaches and water activities, as well as its restaurants, its shopping and its large concentration of Victorian architecture. Built in 1925, this 1,925-square-foot house sits on a corner lot. The kitchen has been updated, central air-conditioning has been installed and the appliances, including a dishwasher and washer and dryer, come with the property. There are one and a half baths, a fireplace, two sunrooms, a rear deck, a patio and a landscaped garden with a koi pond. Taxes are $1,613.59 a year. The seller will provide $2,000 toward closing costs. Vincent J. Tramonte, Joe Tramonte Realty (800) 765-4030; www.tramonterealty.com

Built in 2005, this 1,387-square-foot manufactured home has been finished in a pueblo style on a half-acre just north of Joshua Tree National Park. Twenty-nine Palms, the eastern main entrance of the park, is in the Morongo Basin portion of the Mojave Desert in San Bernardino County. The house is about an hour and a half from the Mojave National Preserve, Big Bear Lake and other desert towns like Palm Springs; downtown Los Angeles is about two and a half hours away. The single-level house has expansive views of the surrounding mountains and canyons and Joshua Tree National Park. It has an eat-in kitchen, which is open to the family room. The kitchen has a dishwasher. There are two full baths, a two-car detached garage, a laundry room, a fenced backyard and a covered front porch. Taxes are about $2,500 a year. Mike Edrington, AFG Realty, (760) 401-5733; www.mikeedrington.com.
